About deprecated: I thing Cam's style suggestion is good. I also suggested to not display deprecated lints by default.

About center-aligned links: I personally really like the 3 "tabs" below the lint doc with the different links. This also makes it look nice on mobile. I'd also be good with moving them to the corner, so I don't have a strong opinion one way or the other.

Cameron Steffen said:

  • Make the the heading box white and the page background gray instead (not really related to your changes)

I would leave the headline background as it is if that's okay. I remember testing other combinations in the theme PR, but this fit the best as it also separated the headline from the documentation.

Cameron Steffen said:

Well the idea is to make it look "dead". And actually I would do the same to the "none" next to it.

I've tired to apply a different opacity to it, as that would be simple then changing the colors and goes with the spirit of looking dead: image.png and it also works with all color themes. What do you think about it?

Cameron Steffen suggested here to remove the colons from the headlines (which I'm in favor of). I was thinking that this also gives us the prime opportunity to change the headline text completely if we would want to. These are some changes that I thought of:

  1. Rename What it does: -> Functionality
  2. Rename Why is this bad? -> Reasoning
  3. Only add the Known problems: section, when the lint actually has known problems.

What are your thoughts about it? :upside_down: These changes would align us a bit more with the rustc documentation. I feel like they would make the documentation cleaner but also a bit more formal, and I'm not sure if we want that.
I think the current section names are easier to understand personally
except that I like bullet 3
Almost all the 'What it does' sections start with 'Checks for' (or similar). I would rename the heading to 'Checks for' and remove that text from the sections.
I also like the current section names over "Functionality" and "Reasoning". I also like point 3. Not sure if we should rename "What it does" to "Checks for", though.
How about What it does -> What it lints
I think "What it lints" leads into "Why is this bad" nicely. And it also allows you to remove "Checks for" like @Michael Wright said.

I was comparing with the Dart equivalent to our lints page. They start each lint doc with a DO or DO NOT statement. I like the directness of this and I like the option of describing what the coder should do (DO) for some lints, since this is easier to describe in some cases.

So now I'm wondering if we should stick with What it does since it allows us that flexibility. What it lints forces us to always describe what not to do. Although, if we are already following that pattern, we can easily stick with it. Actually, this pairs with our lint naming convention - we prefer naming lints as describing what you should not do so that it makes sense with warn(bad_thing).

TL;DR I just talked in a circle.

I'm not to keen on changing the first section to checks for. Let's leave the headlines as they are, except known problems: will only be added when the lint actually has a known problem.
Thank you for sharing your though :upside_down:
What about my idea What it lints? :cry:
Totally fine to leave it. Just making sure you didn't miss that.
I thought that was also included in your TL;DR :sweat_smile: That being said, I think it wouldn't work so well with the current content of some "What it does" paragraphs :upside_down:
no lol I see how that was confusing. yeah no problem.
